episode_summary: This episode covers a range of quirky and fascinating facts, including historical bus systems in London, the psychological effects of power posing, a futuristic library project involving Margaret Atwood, and Japan's innovative approach to earthquake preparedness in elevators.

facts.fact: In the 1840s, London buses had straps attached to the driver's arms that you would yank if you wanted to stop.
Standing like Superman can make you more successful.
This year Margaret Atwood submitted her latest novel and it's going to hit the bookshops in the year 2,114.
Japan is considering installing toilets in its lifts.
